This is a timeless masterpiece and a great example of world building and fantastical storytelling.

When I was 12, this show came out and I was completely captivated by it. Nickelodeon, known for wacky shows like SpongeBob, Rocko's Modern Life, and sitcoms like Drake and Josh, took a massive step forward with this anime-inspired animated series that delved into deep philosophical themes, genocide, and war.

While the concept of elemental power in media isn't new, the show's approach to integrating each element into its own nation, reflecting the psyches and philosophies of the respective element, is truly remarkable.

The characters are expertly written and performed, with Zuko being my favorite. His incredible progression from villain to antihero to hero is perfectly captured. Aang is a good character, although a bit too much of a goody-two-shoes at times. Katara, Sokka, and Toph are equally appealing characters.

The show's brilliance lies in its perfect pacing. While there are occasional filler episodes, each one (except The Great Divide) serves a purpose and adds layers to the intriguing story and its world.

It's impressive how the show incorporates heavy topics while maintaining a silly sense of humor. It's frustrating when people dismiss it as just a 'kids show'. The series can be enjoyed by anyone, regardless of age. It doesn't pander and handles the heavy subject matter in a mature way.

After The Legend of Korra, Nickelodeon didn't seem to follow in the footsteps of Avatar, which was disappointing. Kids need more shows like this, to be honest.
a masterpiece in every sense of the word!
Absolutely amazing TV show. Made me laugh multiple times, Aang is so funny. If you haven't watched this before you're missing out.

I'm not going to do separate reviews on every season. Of all the movies and series I've seen , ATLA is the one I have the fewest complaints about (if any at all). Brilliant story, clever world building that is respectful to the existing world cultures and an extremely satisfying ending. What I really love about the series is it's incredibly diverse set of characters: people of unstained character, those who are pure at heart, although struggling in the ways they act, ones who are on the right side, but achieve their goals by unforgivable means, people who act wrongly, but due to heartbreaking backstories, and finally characters which are simply evil. All in all, one of the greatest masterpieces of all time

Greatest tv series I have ever watched and rewatched. I watched it as a kid growing up and enjoyed it a lot. Then during my teenage years, I rewatched it with my sister and my parents. Lately, I rewatched it at university with my Uni friends. Each time I appreciated a completely different aspect of the show. It is utter perfection in world-building, character development and the telling of a good story. All can appreciate the show regardless of age or gender or race. It is the epitome of storytelling.

Aang is the last Airbender on planet earth. After 100 years of being frozen in an iceberg, two kids find him and bring him back to life.

From that point on the journey of the three friends begins.

They travel through the world, so Aang can relearn the elements again.

On their journey they face many ups and downs, but they need to keep going, because Aang is still very young, but with him being the Avatar the fate of the world lays in his hands.

Avatar is definitely a masterpiece for me.

It's just fun to accompany Aang and his friends on their journey, watching the group grow together and seeing Aang realize his responsibility as the avatar.

A clear recommendation for anyone looking for a feel-good series!
This is one of my favorite shows from my childhood

I love the way it portrays the characters and humanizes even those who are in the wrong. I cannot name a single poorly-developed character. I could go on and on about how I admire it's philosophical and spiritual foundation. It encourages the pursuit of learning and living by truth, and it teaches that all life is sacred. I love how it takes the highlights of cultures and histories around the world and brings them together in a unified story of understanding. At the plot's climax, it teaches the importance of justice through non-violence. Throughout the story it shows the blessings of working hard enough to become a master while still maintaining a child-like spirit.
ATLA is one of, if not the greatest animated show of all time

I would give this zero stars if I could, but Rotten Tomatoes won't let me. This has got to be the dumbest show in existence. I would rather sit in a room and bang my head against a wall repeatedly while watching Teletubbies. How are you supposed to take this show seriously when the main character is a bald kid with an arrow on his head so that he doesn't forget where his eyes are? He's an "AiRbEnDeR." What does that even mean? He can bend air? If I reach out, and ball my hands into fists, am I technically holding air? If so, then I can move my hands, and bend the air. WOW! Amazing how that works. The villains are a nation of fire people, and yet they have a BOAT? If you can control fire, WHY DO YOU WANT TO BE NEAR WATER? And why does a hurricane defeat the fire nation? WIND FUELS FIRE! -10/10

Book 1: Water, Avatar's first season, is an incredible introduction to the show. 
Is it flawless? No. I do think this season has some of Avatar's weakest episodes, and the earlier episodes did struggle finding that balance between the action, the comedy, and the drama, but at the same, that's to be expected of the first couple episodes of any TV show.
Most of the episodes were highlighted by their fun and easily likable characters, creative action set pieces, and incredible worldbuilding.
It's definitely not my favorite season of Avatar, but as a first season to a TV show, it's definitely one of the better ones. And it only goes uphill from here! Onto Book 2: Earth!

This show does a good job of presenting a very mature setting in a way that's appropriate for children while simultaneously not feeling "kiddy."  There are a few stumbles along the way (notably The Great Divide), but it's quite good.

"Avatar The Last Airbender" is a stylized show that delves in much more than what you might think on its surface, with breathtaking visuals, immaculate characters, imaginative worldbuilding, incredible storytelling and innovative animation at its forefront brings this indelible first season a status of some of the best animation television still talked about to this day.

Ok so….this is clearly the best series to come out of Nickelodeon ever, but that doesn't mean that it saves it from being the weakest of the three seasons by a pretty big margin. It all really boils down to one thing, which I will talk about in a sec. First all the great stuff about this series: basically everything except the big problem. The problem being when the show goes for episodic adventures and not an over arcing story. The episodic adventures are fine, but it's a little frightening how much better the over arcing story is. Biggest example is episodes 9-11 for me, with them barely being watchable. The worse of this group being the great divide. Also, the characters that they meet during the episodic adventures are way more annoying than in in the other two seasons. Going back to those three episodes, the biggest culprit of this is Jet. Oh My God do I hate Jet! To be fair, the other two seasons I think also have this problem, just not as drastic. If you can look past those things (which I did for the most part), I could argue that this is the greatest American cartoon series ever made. Again, easily the best Nickelodeon series ever made. Go on Netflix and see for yourself!

Unlike the pace of it's live-action adaptation which was slow, the pace is fast, the action sequences are epic, and the storytelling is groundbreaking, although I should also probably say that about the earthbending! Haha get it?! cuz earth also means ground, and I said groundbreaking. Anyways, this is an excellent series so far. Even some of the humor is hilarious

I am very sorry to not give this 5 stars, but this season just is not quite as good as the other two. Granted, it is amazing and I instantly fell in love with it. The fact that anybody compares seasons 1 and 4 of Korra to this is kind of ridiculous to me. Let's begin by getting the weak elements out of the way. First of all, the humor is at its weakest overall in this season. There are obviously plenty of funny moments, but I didn't laugh as much as in other seasons. Another thing is that Katara and Sokka are not really great in this season. Katara is sometimes irrational and even obnoxious and Sokka is not as good a comic relief or a character as in the later seasons. This season also has the weakest episode selection of the three. Episodes like Jet, The Waterbending Scroll, The Great Divide, and The Fortuneteller are some of my least favorites just to name a few. A few too many of these episodes are not much better than passable. That said, everything else is amazing. The Storm is my favorite episode of either Avatar show and many other episodes are great. The animation is beautiful, the emotional moments are strong, and the pacing is top notch. In Avatar, the characters have always been the most important aspect. Here, Aang is very well-developed and entertaining. However, it is Zuko and Iroh who carry this season. I think Zuko's character arc is the greatest in animation, and this season does a great job starting it. However, Iroh will always be my favorite character. He is funny, kind, wise, and just plain awesome. Iroh and Zuko have by far the best dynamic of any two characters in the show. When they are on the screen, you know things are good. Zhao is also a very human villain who never overstays his welcome. The action is well-choreographed and focuses on cool bending and fun slapstick over kicks and flips like in Korra. The worldbuilding is also excellent. Overall, this season is a funny, emotional, action-packed journey with memorable characters and magic that makes up for any minor flaw with these elements. This is simply amazing and must be watched. However, the other two books are definitely better.

i found this to be a solid first season.  you are introduced to many parts of the world and get to see all of the benders in action.  i found the episodic nature a little iffy, but it was still funny, charming, and awesome!

I can see why this show have a lot of fans. It's a good cartoon series. I like the concept and the world-building of Avatar, they are very fascinating for me... And the characters are very interesting too! I hope to see character developments in the next two books!

Overall, it's good but I hope book 2 will be a lot more exciting!

Equal parts fun and complex, Avatar: The Last Airbender only needed a first season to prove that it is one of Nickelodeon's strongest properties. Its rich lore across Asian backgrounds will draw you in enough to get you through the filler episodes.

Although it is the weakest season or book of the trilogy, Avatar spends its first season doing plenty of well crafted world building and lays its foundation for the future seasons to succeed. It also takes its time introducing lots of side characters while giving main characters dedicated episodes throughout making each character have depth though the main protagonist is arguably the weakest character throughout the run of the show. All and all this season would be impressive if the latter seasons weren't so much grander and epic.

Beautiful animation, breathtaking visuals, delightful humor, likable and developed characters, and an engaging storyline, "Avatar: the Last Airbender" is probably one of the greatest shows (for kids and adults) of all time, this first season is a perfect introduction to the show, and a tease for things to come in the next two.

The story was good and I watched it like a hundref times now. And as I grew older the story became much more clearer for me to understand. I'm giving this 4 stars because overall, I don't like the characters' attitudes. In some, they're acting so childish when it comes to problems they have to face. Look, I know that they figure out themselves when they get into arguments and stuff, but mkst of the time they act as children fighting, doing whatever to take revenge and take advantage of bad things even if they're the good guys. And most of the time, Katara just busts out her deceased mother EVERY. DAMN. ARGUMENT. Whatever argument it is, it always comes with her mother even if the argument isn't about family issues. I mean it's hard to lose someone you love, but musn't she let go of thaf? 
And one more thing, in Book 3 Chapter   that they had a play about the main characters. The big question is how could the scriptwriter of some kind of a research team researched so much detail about their journey? Ain't got any ideas?

"SIMPLEMENTE MARAVILLOSA"
Fue difícil para mi explicar con palabras lo mucho que adoro esta serie, cada una de sus 3 partes es un agregado mas de su grandeza, hace años cuando era un niño la experimente por primera vez solo absorbiendo todo con los ojos de un niño que se dejaba a pantallar por cualquier cosa, pero hoy que le re visito, muchísimos años después, después de haber terminado, después de sus cómics, después de esa horrible pesadilla de pelicula y después de su continuación con Korra,puedo darme cuenta de la gran obra atemporal que es y el portento narrativo que tiene, ya de grande la vi con ojos diferentes y pude maravillarse otra vez y con mas intensidad, hay tantas cosas que quisiera comentar, pero a diferencia de otros reviews que he hecho no quiero que me gane el lengua técnico, porque solo quiero dejarme llevar por lo que volver a ver a Aang y compañía en su aventura me hizo sentir.
Empecemos por lo increíblemente original que en su esencia, la leyenda de Aang es, es increíble que una producción americana que simula y se inspira en el arte del anime de territorio asiático, no le pida absolutamente nada a esa corriente, ya que en todo el tiempo que he experimentado viendo animes, creo que me quedo con muchas cosas que he vivido en esta serie, quiero hablar ahora del villano en turno, el antagonista y verdadera leyenda, el príncipe Zuko, como describir a Zuko, el no es solo un villano en busca de poder, ni el príncipe que malhumorado que nos quieren presentar al principio, si no que de verdad es un alma afligida que con el paso del tiempo vemos sus motivos y su evolución como ninguna otra de la serie, al explorar a Zuko, vemos que no solo la guerra afecto al mundo fuera de la nación del fuego, sino , que a los mas allegados también y el con su tío Iroh tendrán de los momentos mas inspiradores y conmovedores de toda la serie.
Aang, Soka y Katara unidos por el destino, se irán descubriendo a ellos mismos, con sus propios motivos y razones tan reales que te quedas absorbido en la ola de drama que ellos tienen que presentar y junto con Appa, momo y la grandisima música de fondo volando hacia el horizonte te dejara hipnotizado y queriendo mas, es inútil como dije al principio tratar de explicar la grandeza de esta obra, solo experimentarla y saber que aun cuando todo parece que se desmorona, en el viaje con estos protagonistas sientes estar al lado de grandes amigos.

This season was definitely more for kids, but as kids shows go it was one of the best I've ever seen. The development of plot and characters over time was impressive. I didn't really like the episodes with their side adventures, but it was still really good, especially near the end.
absolutely amazing character development and plot paceing absolutely one of my favourite shows of all time

Avatar is about a boy named Aang who is to bring balance to the world. Aang is the only one to contain all the four elements. Throughout all the seasons he is on an adventure with new friends and enemies to defeat the firelord who threatens the world with a huge war to become its ruler. My opinion about the avatar is that I really like it as it is one of my childhood movies. I would recommend it to anyone who loves animated series with an adventure with good cliffhangers and confusions that eventually will be solved near the end of the seasons.

People must see the first season of this revolutionary TV show. It is filled with amazing characters, wonderful action and incredible animation. Plus, it really did a good job introducing American kids to Asian and Inuit cultures.
what can be said this has character arc dept this tackles,  genocide. death  of parents empowerment this has it all and it inspires you and it not  for kids its for adult as well

Where to even start. Excellent character development, mesmerizing action sequences, smooth pacing, and clean, expansive lore, this is textbook good storytelling. I'd watched a half a hundred YouTube essays on what makes this series so magical, and now I understand why. It's the convergence of joy, intelligence, and wonder that helps a piece of art transcend its medium. This series can speak to anyone without speaking over anyone.
Best animated series ever created

A wonderful start to an amazing show. Aang is one of the best characters ever put on TV. This is also the best work of Nickelodeon, as they finally managed to make something exceptional. Besides SpongeBob. The storytelling was different but outstanding. The character designs are perfect for comedic effect, but they are also very distinct. The animation style is absolutely lovely. The different scores they use for characters are all amazing.
An excellent a show, it has a great story, i have seen the 3 seasons about 8 times.

World building is done perfectly, character building was done perfectly, plot building was done perfectly.
The world that they crafted is as deep as any show I've ever watched. This show maintains the same great level throughout, and somehow manages to get better and better until the end
Such a good show. Fun, addicting, emotional and powerful in all kind of ways. Great first season witch showed us how the friends intertwined with the story.

I rewatched this show that I remembered and loved from my childhood and found myself to be surprised by the amount of perfection this show has. Avatar: The Last Airbender has an incredible plot within all three of its seasons, beautifully played recursive themes, and perhaps the most perfectly executed examples of character development, especially through Zuko. Avatar is a series meant for all audiences.
An instant classic that will warm the hearts of children and grown-ups alike, its captivating narrative and unforgettable characters demand constant revisiting - and it never ceases to wonder.
Avatar: The Last Airbender does what few children's shows have done before: deliver what was promised.
Best show ever created as of yet
Ever since Netflix brought back the show to stream, I had to relive my childhood. If you hadn't seen this show, please do so.

Avatar the last airbender is one of the greatest tv shows ever, the season 1 is really good, the writing of all the characters are fenomenal, Aang is a super compeling character with a great backstory, and finally I wanna talk about my favorite character in the whole series; the prince Zuko, That is one of the reasons why I love this tv show so much because it takes its time to be with ou heroes and it takes its time to  be with the villans, I think my favorite episode in the first season is probably the blue spirit one because for one episode you think "wow Maybe the villan and the hero can be friends, maybe they could work together" another thing that I wanna to talk about is the animation, at the really begining of the show I thought that the animatoin was gonna be pretty basic, cut then the episode three hapenned and we watch the agni kai, there I realise that the animation was amazing, I will give Avatar: the last airbender season 1 a 9 out of 10 ( or a 8 out of 10 I don't know)

Beautiful and full of life. The cast of characters is incredibly likeable and the show's quality improves throughout the season. It seems to be the least memorable of the three seasons, however the other seasons set an extremely high standard to match. Well worth the watch and establishes the world very well. The finale is among the best episodes of Avatar, and is a sign of the quality to come in the later seasons.
Amazing entrance to a journey
Avatar: The Last Airbender is a TV series that I loved as a kid and continue to love as an adult. For me, that is a test that no other animated series has passed.

One of the few "perfect" shows. I'd even say one of the only shows without filler episodes. This is a must-see for anyone who hasn't seen it and is also the only 5 star I will ever give a TV show. The action, comedy, drama, and worldbuilding all balance perfectly and definitely deserves all the attention it can get.

This show start off very strong!  It presents a fantasy world for anyone to just get completely lost in.  Almost instantly you fall in lost with the characters.  This show is a most-see for any fans of the YA fantasy adventure genre!

I love this series.  It is one of the best ever made.  The writing is incredible, being both episodic and part of a larger story.  The music is phenomenal and often brings goosebumps.  The animation really illustrates the choreography of the martial arts and different forms of "bending".

And it only gets better from here!
Amazing! Absolutely fantastic. One of the best shows I have ever seen. Funny, driven, and moving. An engaging story line and even better characters!!
This is by far the greatest show of all time. Flawless character arcs and captivating animations!
The least good of the three seasons, which doesn't mean much for a perfect series.
Obviously, Avatar The Last Airbender is a masterpiece through out the entire show, but Season 1 is a Introduction (quote from 24 Frames of Nick on YouTube).

Just such a great show. I continue to keep watching the show even after watching the entire thing because it's just perfectly made. The fight scenes are always great, and some of the character arcs are fantastic. Not to mention how these animated characters feel like real people. Show interest in one another, trying to go through change and move on from certain things. I found myself teary eyed when it came to Ua's death and AANG STRAIGHT UP DYING IN SEASON TWO. And the ending of the entire show really has this powerful message as instead of killing the fire lord, Aang takes away his bending to ensure he can't hurt anyone else again. And while there are serious moments, there is plenty of space for funny moments (mostly from Sokka). This show is 20/5 and I very much recommend it.
Deep and entertaining, Avatar, The Last Airbender's mature narrative proves and expands the boundaries of animated storytelling.
I love the story line, animation, and how the characters change over time
The finest series in the world. It deserves the 100% rating.

Classic animated series that holds as one of the best ever produced, thanks to a superb vocal cast and rich storytelling.  The cast is top notch, with the main characters evolving richly over three seasons, along with some great guest voices, from Jason Isaacs to Mark Hamill.  Behind the camera, creators Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko craft a rich world and story, with wonderful nods to Chinese culture and martial arts (for example, each bending style is based on a real kung fu style).  While the story is a little cartoony at first, it soon evolves into a true epic of Aang fulfilling his destiny with the help of his friends, while other characters are at initially enemies go through unexpected paths (Prince Zuko's story arc is arguably just as important as Aang's).  Simple put, one of the finest cartoons ever made, and a must watch for anyone.

Sure, it's a children's cartoon, but its solid mythology, universal themes and clever balance between humour and action should appeal to viewers of all ages - especially if they have patience, and respect the medium

The creators of this show have painstakingly built a world that, once invested in, you never want to leave. The setting is rich in lore and vast in scope - encompassing the length and breath of an entire fantasy world. The action blends martial arts and elemental magic seamlessly, while the morals incorporate also lessons of mindfulness and friendship. As for the story - time and time again I remember this show and a pang of sadness hits me as I am reminded of the journey that I took with Aang, Katara and Sokka, and how, by finishing the series, my time with them is at an end. 
When searching for new things to watch online, I often use phrases like 'animated series as good as avatar' - but as yet I've found none. This is my favourite TV series of all time, and I know there are many out there who agree with me!
it is a amazing show!!!!

The big part in this book 1 is the introduction to Aang Katara and Sokka, the way DiMartino and Konietzko introduce them is fun and understandable at the same time. This makes a really good first impression to this movie. Till the finale, this is not disappointing and fun. I give 93% to this season, good job!
The first chapter in one of the greatest TV show ever!

Avatar takes you to a fabulous journey of self spiritual discovery, with a mix of adventure, witty comedy, extraordinary martial arts action and complex character developments. The series succeeds in getting you fully entangled in its drama, presenting you with an amazingly captivating plot.
You become an instant fan once you finish watching it!You become an instant fan once you finish watching it!

The characters are great, the story is deep and is just great.
The first season was quite boring, and I almost stopped watching it twice. Luckilly, I kept going, because the next two seasons are perfect.

While the weakest of the three seasons due to the time it takes to "get the ball rolling" per-say, this is still an amazing season that sets up so much lore, character traits, and breathtaking moments. An amazing setup for an amazing series.

I love the characters they establish, I love the semi focus on the spirits in this season (no one forgets the visuals in that finale!). It's just so well crafted and clever and great.
very nice kickoff to a great show!!

The first season of Airbender successfully introduces us to a spectacular and fully realized world, full of interesting characters and narrative heft. If not for what comes after, Season 1 would gain the adulation it absolutely deserves.

The American television series that was commercially successful and acclaimed for its outstanding animation and plot. I've finally watched the whole thing from beginning to end and I can now say it's one of the best and most epic animated TV shows of all time. In a war-torn world of elemental magic, a young boy reawakens to undertake a dangerous mystic quest to fulfill his destiny as the Avatar, and bring peace to the world. Touching on mature themes like war, genocide and imperialism, it is also a series with a defined structure, full of compelling and well-developed characters and a funny sense of humor and good morals. Each episode is a great adventure in its own right, usually concluded with stunning action sequences!!

ATLA is what animated shows should aspire to be.  Possibly the greatest and most universal and relateable series I have ever seen.  I have watched this show time and time against and I can't say I am enjoying it any less.  If anything I am noticing new themes and underlying references than I did before.

Season one starts off slow and sets the scene for the greatness to come.
